breaks up into the outer & inner capsules;
while the inner capsule <s><u>tractus medius <\u><<\s> almost immediately after 
<s>the tra <\s> it has been separated from the tractus externus <s>outer <\s>
is joined by the fibres of the <u>tractus medius <\u>. The 
<u>tractus medius <\u> represents simply a few of the 
crossed callosal fibres wh: at first are separate from 
the others. They seem to be <s>formed by <\s> those fibres 
wh: lie closest to the anterior horn of the lateral 
ventricle. <s>The crossed fibres This round almost 
come onl <\s> The circuitous course followed 
by the anterior callosal fibres <s>from the under surface <\s>
of the frontal lobe is necessitated & probably 
caused by the interposition of the anterior horn 
of the lateral ventricle and the large head of 
the caudate nucleus. They have to circumvent 
these obstructions before they can reach the 
two capsules on the other side, and <s>[text?]<\s> it 
can easily be perceived how they would be 
pushed aside in the development of the brain 
when the basal ganglia are being forced up 
from the <s>bran <\s> base of the cerebral vesicle.
